nodes.text: "Daa Hutt muna" was a song performed by the Pa'lowick singer Sy Snootles. Accompanied by three Twi'lek dancers, Snootles performed the song in front of the Hutt Ruling Council at Gardulla the Hutt's Palace located in the Hutt homeworld of Nal Hutta.

The musical number of "Daa Hutt muna" shown in the Star Wars: The Clone Wars episode "Hunt for Ziro" was an homage to the opening sequence of the 1984 film Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom, in which Willie Scott and her dancers perform in Mandarin the song Anything Goes at Club Obi-Wan.
